Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: The Life and Opinions of Tristram Shandy, Gentleman
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Laurence Sterne
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A pioneering work of metafiction and narrative experimentation that influenced later literary movements.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Swann's Way
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Marcel Proust
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: The beginning of Proust's exploration of memory and consciousness, serving as an inspiration for the introspective style of the New Novel.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Ulysses
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: James Joyce
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A seminal modernist novel, featuring stream of consciousness and narrative experimentation.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: To the Lighthouse
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Virginia Woolf
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A highly introspective work that influenced the interior focus of the New Novel.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: The Sound and the Fury
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: William Faulkner
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A multi-perspective narrative focused on fragmented time and unreliable narrators.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: The Man Without Qualities
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Robert Musil
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: An unfinished work that uses introspection and a fragmented narrative to explore societal decline.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: The Waves
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Virginia Woolf
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: An experimental narrative structure focusing on six characters’ inner voices over time.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Man's Fate
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: André Malraux
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A philosophical novel with a disjointed narrative that reflects early existentialism.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Nausea
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A novel that questions reality and consciousness, prefiguring the existential themes of the New Novel.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Tropisms
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Nathalie Sarraute
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A series of vignettes capturing fleeting psychological movements.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: The Stranger
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Albert Camus
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: The detached narrative style helped lay the groundwork for the emotionally neutral tone of the New Novel.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Aurélien
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Louis Aragon
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: A psychological romance exploring inner conflicts and fleeting emotions.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: Between the Acts
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Virginia Woolf
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: An introspective story that foreshadows the New Novel’s focus on fragmented experience. In Woolf's last novel, the action takes place on one summer's day at a country house in the heart of England, where the villagers are presenting their annual pageant. A lyrical, moving valedictory.

Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.title: The Plague
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.author: Albert Camus
Proto_New_Novel_Precursors_to_the_Moveme.description: Blends philosophical inquiry with narrative detachment, similar to the New Novel’s themes.

Key_Authors.title: Portrait of a Man Unknown
Key_Authors.author: Nathalie Sarraute
Key_Authors.description: A novel that exemplifies Sarraute's focus on the subconscious and psychological realism.

Key_Authors.title: The Erasers
Key_Authors.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Key_Authors.description: A detective story that challenges traditional narrative structure and causality.

Key_Authors.title: The Voyeur
Key_Authors.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Key_Authors.description: Features a detached examination of human behavior and perception.

Key_Authors.title: Jealousy
Key_Authors.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Key_Authors.description: An intensely descriptive work emphasizing the breakdown of traditional storytelling.

Key_Authors.title: The Grass
Key_Authors.author: Claude Simon
Key_Authors.description: Combines flashbacks and stream-of-consciousness techniques to reflect on memory.

Key_Authors.title: Triptych
Key_Authors.author: Claude Simon
Key_Authors.description: novel that weaves together three seemingly disparate narratives: a World War I battle, a family’s history, and a contemporary story of a man’s search for his missing brother. Through non-linear storytelling and fragmented narrative structures, Simon explores the interconnectedness of human experiences, the cyclical nature of time, and the ways in which individuals are shaped by their family histories and cultural contexts.

Key_Authors.title: The Planetarium
Key_Authors.author: Nathalie Sarraute
Key_Authors.description: Explores the microcosms of the mind through fragmented narrative techniques.

Key_Authors.title: In the Labyrinth
Key_Authors.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Key_Authors.description: Examines fragmented reality and time through a non-linear narrative.

Key_Authors.title: The Flanders Road
Key_Authors.author: Claude Simon
Key_Authors.description: Uses shifting perspectives and non-linear time to recount war.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: Malone Dies
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Samuel Beckett
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: Part of Beckett’s trilogy, the narrative dissects subjectivity and pushes linguistic minimalism.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: Passing Time
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Michel Butor
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: Centers on dislocated time and subjective perception.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: Changing Track
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Michel Butor
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: An introspective monologue told in the second person.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: Moderato Cantabile
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Marguerite Duras
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: A story that deconstructs language and conventional romance.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: The Inquisitory
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Robert Pinget
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: A question-and-answer narrative exploring hidden depths of the human psyche.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: For a New Novel: Essays on Fiction
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: A manifesto outlining the theoretical underpinnings of the New Novel.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: La Maison de Rendez-Vous
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: A cryptic story where setting takes precedence over plot.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: Things: A Story of the Sixties
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Georges Perec
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: A critique of consumer culture told in detached, observational prose.

Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.title: Portrait of a Man Known as Il Condottiere
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.author: Georges Perec
Other_Authors_Aligning_with_the_Movement.description: Examines an art forger’s inner conflicts through a fragmented narrative.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: Tomb for 500,000 Soldiers
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Pierre Guyotat
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: A brutal, fragmented story emphasizing the absurdity of war.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: Project for a Revolution in New York
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Alain Robbe-Grillet
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: An experimental narrative intertwining erotica and surreal imagery.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: India Song
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Marguerite Duras
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: A narrative with overlapping voices, reflecting on the distance between past and present.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: Missing Person
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Patrick Modiano
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: A detective story that explores memory and identity in a dreamlike narrative.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: Life: A User's Manual
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Georges Perec
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: A novel structured like a puzzle, reflecting on how narratives intertwine and build.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: The Book of Disquiet
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Fernando Pessoa
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: A fragmented collection of reflections on identity and existence.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: The Lover
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Marguerite Duras
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: A quasi-autobiographical story that breaks with linear storytelling.

Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.title: White Noise
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.author: Don DeLillo
Post_New_Novel_Influenced_by_the_Movemen.description: Examines consumer culture and language with a detached, postmodern sensibility.
